title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 9, Appendices, app C-1
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 9, Appendices, app C-1

State Regulations
(cf. Part 135)
TITLES AND POSITIONS INELIGIBLE TO ACCRUE OVERTIME
CREDITS
The following positions are ineligible to accrue overtime
credits in accordance with the overtime rules promulgated by the Director of
the Budget, effective February 1, 1967. (See Part 135, Overtime

Compensation.)
ALL STATE DEPARTMENTS AND AGENCIES
All positions allocated to grade 22 and below: Administrative assistant (SG 18) (field)

Artist designer IV (SG 18)

Artist designer V (SG 20)

Associate marketing representative (SG 19)

Attorney (all parenthetics) (SG 19)

Nongraded titles and positions ineligible to accrue overtime
credits. All positions allocated or equated (by the Director of the

Budget) to grade 23 and above are ineligible to receive overtime compensa-tion
as are all nongraded positions which are unequated and whose salary is equal to
or greater than the hiring rate of grade 23. Additionally, other titles and
positions which are allocated or equated to grade 22 or below, or paid a salary
less than the hiring rate of grade 23, are ineligible for overtime compensation
if their job requirements (as stated in job specifications, job standards or
duties statements) meet any of the criteria for in-eligibility in Part 135.2 of
the Budget Director's Overtime Rules. The following positions are ineligible to accrue overtime
credits in accordance with the overtime rules promulgated by the Director of
the Budget, effective February 1, 1967. (See Part 135, Overtime

Compensation.)

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
